sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: In this document, the term 'ActionScript class' refers to the C++ class which is instantiated by Gnash when some ActionScript code instantiates a corresponding class. The C++ class stores instance data and implements the methods which are called on the object in the ActionScript code.

sect2.title: Object Creation Overview
sect2.para: When Gnash starts, the class_init() method for each ActionScript class (listed in Global.cpp) is called. This method constructs a prototype, which is implemented as an as_object. In addition, the method registers the constructor to be used for future object creation, and attaches methods and properties to the prototype.
When a new object is needed, instance data is added to the methods and properties inherited from the prototype.
